title: Davis Square Rules
name: Davis Square Rules
description:
A Map by Davis

All the goodness of Davis Square

properties.name: Anna's Taqueria
properties.description: Posted by Davissomerville, MA

properties.name: Blue Shirt Cafe Incorporated
properties.description: Posted by Davis  424 Highland Ave, Somerville, MAThe Blue Shirt is known for their specialty wraps, sandwiches and salads. Favorites include the Sesame Chicken wrap and Mediterranean-style Beef Katban wrap (all wraps also available as salad bowls). My boyfriend rides the entire length of the red line from college literally every day to eat lunch here... for good reason, this food is AMAZING!

properties.name: Comicazi
properties.description: Posted by Davis407 Highland Ave, 02144

properties.name: Dave's Fresh Pasta
properties.description: Posted by Davis81 Holland St, Somerville, MAGreat place to pick up fresh gourmet italian food to enjoy at home!

properties.name: Davis Square Dental
properties.description: Posted by Davis51 Holland Street Somerville, MA 02144One of the most popular dentist offices in Somerville; a regular winner of "Best of Somerville." Both the dentist (Dr. Cook) and his staff are generally known to be helpful and friendly.

properties.name: Diesel
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   The Diesel is huge, but even so it can be hard to find a place to sit on the weekend. Go all the way to the back for the cozy kntialicious sofa spots. Their tea service is a bit lacking (no teapots, only glasses). They have a pool table, booths, a counter with stools, little round tables. It\'s a wonderful place to sit and watch snow fall. Wireless internet costs about a day. They have a photo booth.

properties.name: Diva
properties.description: Posted by Davis 246 Elm St 02144The lunch buffet is pretty good. They serve goat! Boston.com review Citysearch Tufts Daily review I haven\'t been to the bar yet. I like the look of the over-the-top bubble wrap interior, but I saw two absolutely gionormous flat-screen television sets behind the bar, which is a huge turn off. Lose the TV, Diva! Are you hip enough to entertain people without showing the baseball game or what???

properties.name: Gargoyles on the Square
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 219 Elm St, Somerville, MAGargoyles on the Square (617) 776-5300 Goargoyle\'s is a tad spendy, but completely worth it. I particularly am fond of the duck drumsticks and the salmon tartare. Expert drink mixing. Fantasticly perfect margaritas and martinis. I was there last night and had a luscious Tom Collins. It\'s nice to sit at the bar and talk to the people around you. It\'s really friendly and the music doesn\'t drown out conversation.

properties.name: Johnny D's
properties.description: Posted by Davis17 Holland St, Somerville MAMusic club, good food, nice folks

properties.name: Magpie
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  This is the shop run by the same people who do Craftster.org and the Bizarre Bazaar. They sell fantastic crafty crafts. It\'s a couple blocks off Davis, but worth the detour. Go there. Buy things. Be amazed.

properties.name: Namaskar
properties.description: Posted by Davis236 Elm St., somerville maThrough generally dead compared to nearby, trendier Diva, the food at Namaskar speaks for itself. This is one of the best Indian restaurants in the Boston area.

properties.name: Orleans Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Davis 65 Holland Street Somerville, MA 02144A great place if you want to watch satellite-only sports games in a friendly environment.

properties.name: Redbones
properties.description: Posted by Davis 55 Chester St, Somerville, MARedbones restaurant is a great BBQ joint, but I don\'t actually like going there. I prefer to call for delivery, which is brought by bicycle, and usually arrives faster than your waiter if you actually went in for table service. Tasty and recommended. Redbones also sponsors NERAX, the New England Real Ale eXhibition, which is a fantastic annual beer-tasting event.(617) 628.2200 · mail@redbones.com RedBones opens to serve lunch daily at 11:30am (noon on Sundays). Dinner is served from 4:00pm \'til 10:30 (11:00pm on Fri/Sat) We also have a ate night menu every night until 12:30 a.m.

properties.name: Sacco's Bowl Haven
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 45 Day St, Somerville, MA Hours of Operation: Call 617-776-0552 for more info. Monday: 9:00 AM - 11:30 PM Tuesday: 9:00 AM - 12:00 AM Wednesday: 9:30 AM - 12:00 AM Thursday: 9:30 AM - 12:00 AM Friday: 10:00 AM - 12:00 AM Saturday: 10:00 AM - 12:00 AM Sunday: 12:00 PM - 11:30 PM They do parties. Candlepin bowling, billiards, and a juke box. I love Sacco\'s. Be sure to read the newspaper clippings on the walls. A bunch of my girlfriends and I used to come on Wednesdays for knitting and bowling. The guys at Sacco\'s were incredibly nice to us. From the website: "Established in 1939, Bowl Haven has remained true to its roots of old fashioned good times. The 4th generation of the Sacco family is keeping a way of life, as their ancestors knew it, alive and thriving. Haven\'s original rock hard maple lanes and ball returns, and it\'s 1950s decor make bowling the way it was, the way it is. You can also rack\'em up on one of 8 tables in our pool room."

properties.name: Somerville Theater
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  55 Davis Sq, Somerville, MAThe Somerville Theater is a local institution. They show wonderful movies here and they also have great concerts and festivals.

properties.name: The Burren
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    247 Elm St, Somerville, MAThe Burren (617) 776-6896 The Burren is huge inside with a front room and concerts in the back room. It\'s a friendly Irish pub with decent food.

properties.name: Theatre@First
properties.description: Posted by Davis95 College Avenue, Somerville, MA

properties.name: Tu Y Yo
properties.description: Posted by Davis858 Broadway, Somerville, MA 02144http://tuyyomexicanfonda.com/ A great place for upscale Mexican food. Quiet for early dinner (6pm), and gets bustling soon after.

properties.name: Your Move Games
properties.description: Posted by Davis 389 Highland Ave, Somerville, MAGame store with table top games, war gaming figurines, and more. Anyone know the store hours?
